A **bill-guisarme** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed") [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") that is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **hooked polearm** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

## Generation

In addition to random generation, general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and antique weapons outlets can sell bill-guisarmes.

[Watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") and [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") may [be generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a bill-guisarme.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

The bill-guisarme is tied for the third-heaviest polearm with the [bardiche](/wiki/Bardiche "Bardiche"), and among polearms it has relatively high damage against [small](/wiki/Small "Small") monsters and decent average damage against large monsters. While this makes it a good polearm option, the [ranseur](/wiki/Ranseur "Ranseur") also offers comparable damage for nearly 2⁄5 of the bill-guisarme's [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight").

## History

The bill-guisarme is introduced with all other polearms in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Bill (weapon)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_\(weapon\) "wikipedia:Bill (weapon)")***

[![Bill-guisarmes.png](/images/thumb/b/bf/Bill-guisarmes.png/150px-Bill-guisarmes.png)](/wiki/File:Bill-guisarmes.png)



A bill is a class of agricultural implement used for trimming tree limbs that was often repurposed for use as an infantry polearm in medieval Europe - this was done through the addition of various projecting blades, with the bill-guisarme being one such variant. As a weapon, the bill is similar in size, function and appearance to the [halberd](/wiki/Halberd "Halberd"), and may represent convergent evolution in polearm weapon design due to its thrusting point, hook and spike/axe. The English distinguished among several varieties of bill, including the black, brown and forest bills, but the differences between them are currently not fully understood; some bill-guisarmes are also known simply as [guisarmes](/wiki/Guisarme "Guisarme").

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), the bill-guisarme has its weight reduced to 80 aum, the same as the guisarme.

### NetHack Fourk

[NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk") removes the bill-guisarme and many other polearms.

### xNetHack

[xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack") removes the bill-guisarme and many other polearms.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), a bill-guisarme can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a guisarme and a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"). This also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").
